law.catch_line: Quorum; organization and procedures at meetings.

text.section:
Sec. 2-1943. Quorum; organization and procedures at meetings.
A quorum shall be a majority of the duly appointed and sitting members.
Harvey Ruvin shall serve as the initial chairperson for a three (3) year term. Thereafter, the chairperson shall be elected annually by a majority vote of the duly appointed membership.
At the initial meeting, the chairperson shall appoint another member to serve a one (1) year term as vice-chairperson, subject to approval by a majority vote of those members in attendance. Thereafter, the vice-chairperson shall be selected and approved annually in the same manner. The CCATF shall adopt rules of procedure for its own governance.
The chairperson shall nominate and the CCATF shall appoint, by a majority vote of those members in attendance, a chairperson and members for such committees as the CCATF finds helpful to its mission. Each committee shall be chaired by a duly appointed member of the CCATF, however, the committee membership may include persons who are not members of the CCATF. A committee shall have no authority to act or speak on behalf of the CCATF. The CCATF may establish or eliminate committees at its discretion.
The CCATF shall hold not less than four (4) regular meetings each year.
